thread.title: Boys soccer: Montclair seeded third in Essex County Tournament
thread.title_full: Boys soccer: Montclair seeded third in Essex County Tournament

title: Boys soccer: Montclair seeded third in Essex County Tournament
text:
Boys soccer: Montclair seeded third in Essex County Tournament October 16, 2015 Last updated: Friday, October 16, 2015, 12:31 PM The Montclair Times Buy this photo Staff Photo by Nick Verhagen Quinn Baity, left, and his Montclair High teammates earned the No. 3 seed in the upcoming Essex County Tournament. 
Thanks to its seven-game unbeaten streak stretching back almost a full month, the Montclair High School boys soccer team earned the No. 3 seed at Tuesday night's seeding meeting for the 2015 Essex County Tournament. 
Unbeaten West Orange, the most recent team to defeat Montclair (a 2-0 win at Fortunato Field on Sept. 17), earned the tournament's No. 1 seed and will look to capture its first county crown since 2006. 
The Mounties (8-2-2 overall) have won six ECT championships in their history, the most recent coming in 2013. 
The current Mounties have allowed just three goals during their seven-game unbeaten streak, which featured six wins and a scoreless draw with Seton Hall Prep last Wednesday. 
The Pirates were selected as the No. 2 seed. 
Twenty-six teams entered this year's county tournament, with the top 10 seeds receiving byes through to the Round of 16, which will be played on or before Wednesday, Oct. 21. 
The rest of the field will have to navigate a two-round "play-in" bracket to earn the remaining six spots in the Round of 16. 
The Montclair Kimberley Academy was seeded 11th and is the top-ranked team that must go through the play-in bracket. 
The Cougars will host either No. 22 Newark Technology or No. 23 Cedar Grove in their preliminary-round game, which must be played on or before Monday, Oct. 19. Should it advance, MKA would visit No. 6 Newark Academy in the Round of 16. 
The play-in bracket that will determine Montclair's Round of 16 opponent includes No. 14 Newark Tech, as well as No. 19 Glen Ridge and No. 26 North 13th Street Tech. 
Mounties win on long road trip 
Saturday morning, Montclair extended its unbeaten streak to seven by heading down the Shore and leaving with a 3-1 victory over Ocean Township. 
The Mounties did all their scoring in the first five minutes after halftime, with Quinn Baity breaking a scoreless tie with his team-leading sixth goal of the season in the 42nd minute, quickly followed by an own goal and a Gabe Friedin tally moments later. 
Cougars top belleville 
Saturday afternoon, Dylan Ladda netted twice to propel MKA to a 2-0 victory over Belleville in a non-conference matchup. 
Seth Kaplan and Alex Cappitelli each assisted on a goal as the Cougars (3-6-1) scored multiple goals for the first time this season. 
-Kevin Meacham Â© 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
